verses.verse: Why, seeing times <WH6256> are not hidden <WH6845> <WH8738> from 'El SHaddai <WH7706>, do they that know <WH3045> <WH8802> him not see <WH2372> <WH8804> his days <WH3117> ?
Some remove <WH5381> <WH8686> the landmarks <WH1367>; they violently take away <WH1497> <WH8804> flocks <WH5739>, and feed <WH7462> <WH8799> thereof.
They drive away <WH5090> <WH8799> the ass <WH2543> of the fatherless <WH3490>, they take <WH2254> the widow's <WH490> ox <WH7794> for a pledge <WH2254> <WH8799>.
They turn <WH5186> <WH8686> the needy <WH34> out of the way <WH1870>: the poor <WH6041> <WH8675> <WH6035> of the earth <WH776> hide <WH2244> <WH8795> themselves together <WH3162>.

Behold, as wild asses <WH6501> in the desert <WH4057>, go they forth <WH3318> <WH8804> to their work <WH6467>; rising betimes <WH7836> <WH8764> for a prey <WH2964>: the wilderness <WH6160> yieldeth food <WH3899> for them and for their children <WH5288>.
They reap <WH7114> <WH8799> <WH8675> <WH7114> <WH8686> every one his corn <WH1098> in the field <WH7704>: and they gather <WH3953> <WH8762> the vintage <WH3754> of the wicked <WH7563>.
They cause the naked <WH6174> to lodge <WH3885> <WH8686> without clothing <WH3830>, that they have no covering <WH3682> in the cold <WH7135>.
They are wet <WH7372> <WH8799> with the showers <WH2230> of the mountains <WH2022>, and embrace <WH2263> <WH8765> the rock <WH6697> for want of a shelter <WH4268>.
They pluck <WH1497> <WH8799> the fatherless <WH3490> from the breast <WH7699>, and take a pledge <WH2254> <WH8799> of the poor <WH6041>.
They cause him to go <WH1980> <WH8765> naked <WH6174> without clothing <WH3830>, and they take away <WH5375> <WH8804> the sheaf <WH6016> from the hungry <WH7457>;
Which make oil <WH6671> <WH8686> within <WH996> their walls <WH7791>, and tread <WH1869> <WH8804> their winepresses <WH3342>, and suffer thirst <WH6770> <WH8799>.

Men <WH4962> groan <WH5008> <WH8799> from out of the city <WH5892>, and the soul <WH5315> of the wounded <WH2491> crieth out <WH7768> <WH8762>: yet 'Elohim <WH433> layeth <WH7760> <WH8799> not folly <WH8604> to them.
They are of those that rebel <WH4775> <WH8802> against the light <WH216>; they know <WH5234> <WH8689> not the ways <WH1870> thereof, nor abide <WH3427> <WH8804> in the paths <WH5410> thereof.
The murderer <WH7523> <WH8802> rising <WH6965> <WH8799> with the light <WH216> killeth <WH6991> <WH8799> the poor <WH6041> and needy <WH34>, and in the night <WH3915> is as a thief <WH1590>.

The eye <WH5869> also of the adulterer <WH5003> <WH8802> waiteth <WH8104> <WH8804> for the twilight <WH5399>, saying <WH559> <WH8800>, No eye <WH5869> shall see <WH7789> <WH8799> me: and disguiseht <WH5643> <WH7760> <WH8799> his face <WH6440>.

In the dark <WH2822> they dig through <WH2864> <WH8804> houses <WH1004>, which they had marked <WH2856> <WH8765> for themselves in the daytime <WH3119>: they know <WH3045> <WH8804> not the light <WH216>.
For the morning <WH1242> is to them even as <WH3162> the shadow of death <WH6757>: if one know <WH5234> <WH8686> them, they are in the terrors <WH1091> of the shadow of death <WH6757>.

He is swift <WH7031> as the waters <WH6440> <WH4325>; their portion <WH2513> is cursed <WH7043> <WH8792> in the earth <WH776>: he beholdeth <WH6437> <WH8799> not the way <WH1870> of the vineyards <WH3754>.
Drought <WH6723> and heat <WH2527> consume <WH1497> <WH8799> the snow <WH7950> waters <WH4325>: so doth the grave <WH7585> those which have sinned <WH2398> <WH8804>.

The womb <WH7358> shall forget <WH7911> <WH8799> him; the worm <WH7415> shall feed sweetly <WH4988> <WH8804> on him; he shall be no more remembered <WH2142> <WH8735>; and wickedness <WH5766> shall be broken <WH7665> <WH8735> as a tree <WH6086>.
He evil entreateth <WH7462> <WH8802> the barren <WH6135> that beareth <WH3205> <WH8799> not: and doeth not good <WH3190> <WH8686> to the widow <WH490>.
He draweth <WH4900> <WH8804> also the mighty <WH47> with his power <WH3581>: he riseht up <WH6965> <WH8799>, and no man is sure <WH539> <WH8686> of life <WH2416>.
Though it be given <WH5414> <WH8799> him to be in safety <WH983>, whereon he resteth <WH8172> <WH8735>; yet his eyes <WH5869> are upon their ways <WH1870>.

They are exalted <WH7426> <WH8804> for a little while <WH4592>, but are gone and brought low <WH4355> <WH8717>; they are taken out <WH7092> <WH8735> of the way <WH1870> as all other, and cut off <WH5243> <WH8799> as the tops <WH7218> of the ears of corn <WH7641>.
And if it be not so now <WH645>, who will make <WH7760> <WH8799> me a liar <WH3576> <WH8686>, and make <WH7760> <WH8799> my speech <WH4405> nothing worth <WH408> ?
